page.title: 06THE NAPOLEON ROOM
page.content: The life of{Napoleon Bonaparte}was one of the 5th Earl of Rosebery's interests. The intensity of this interest is reflected by the dedication of a whole room to Napoleonic memorabilia. The Earl owned the outstanding portrait of Napoleon by{Jacques_Louis {David}but this is now on view in the National Gallery of Art in Washington D.C and only a photograph remains at Dalmeny. The{Appiani}portraits of Napoleon as the victor at Lodi and after his coronation as King of Italy are still at Dalmeny. In addition, there are four portraits of his family by{Lefebre:}Josephine; Marie Louise, her successor as Empress; Madame Mere and Napoleon's brother, Joseph, King of Spain.There is also a portrait of Napoleon's other brother,Lucien, the Prince of Canino. (next page)
